intro: Adina microcephala, commonly known as the small-headed adina, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Asia. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes coffee and gardenias. The plant is characterized by its small, rounded leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. Adina microcephala is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests and along stream banks.
